title: Need help with DD-WRT and port forwarding with League and Steam
body:
So recently my step-father decided to create a VPN for our network and it is preventing me from accessing Steam and League.  I do have a list of port forwarding for both and I did do the League tutorial on port forwarding and nothing happened. I also looked up on setting up port forwards but most of the tutorials do not use DD-WRT on youtube so it was slightly confusing to translate to DD-WRT.  There is a support ticket that I am currently getting resolved as well, this is just for assistence with the trying to get this shit to work and if I need to add anything. Also do I need to restart my router every time I add or remove a port?
Thanks in Advance
-Kanjimaru

replies.body: Sometimes these VPN's and port forwarding and be a little tricky. It looks like one of our tech guys has started helping you in a ticket, so you're in good hands there. They'll be able to go much more in depth than I can on the boards, so keep working with them through that ticket!

He is doing a Great Job. Your tech guys really do know how to help people by just going through simple diagnosis stuff, and moving through the motions like how a pitcher who is doing really well in a baseball game. Hopefully We can find a solution this stuff is pretty advanced to me. I am just going to enjoy this break from the salt mines till either I figure what is wrong or until a solution is found that does not require me to go all {{champion:254}}  on this and just break the VPN to where no one can use the internet here.
